function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of specific description of 'possible sample' leading to sampling bias","Impact":"Inaccurate representation of the population, leading to skewed results","Mitigation":"Provide clear and specific criteria for 'possible sample' to ensure unbiased sampling","Technologies":"N/A","People":"Researchers, statisticians, survey designers","Owner":"Researchers, survey designers"},{"Description":"Adoption of easy random sampling without consideration of population characteristics","Impact":"Misrepresentation of universal issues like COVID-19 pandemic in specific populations","Mitigation":"Consider stratified sampling or use additional sampling techniques to ensure representation of diverse populations","Technologies":"N/A","People":"Researchers, survey designers","Owner":"Researchers, survey designers"},{"Description":"Dependence on the central limit theorem for sample sizes greater than 30","Impact":"Risk of overlooking variability in small sample sizes, leading to inaccurate conclusions","Mitigation":"Utilize techniques like bootstrapping or non-parametric statistics to account for variability in small sample sizes","Technologies":"Bootstrapping, non-parametric statistics","People":"Statisticians, researchers","Owner":"Statisticians, researchers"}]}
